p: (2) Determination of the Total Antioxidant Capacity. The total antioxidant capacity (TAC) of extracts was measured with the phosphomolybdenum method according to Hossain and Shah [ 28] protocol adapted for 96-well microplates. The phosphomolybdate reagent solution was prepared freshly by mixing 50 mL of H 2SO 4 (0.6 M), 50 mL of Na 3PO 4 (28 mM), and 50 mL of (NH 4) 6Mo 7O 244H 2O (4 mM). The calibration curve was established with ascorbic acid (0–50 μg/mL). The phosphomolybdate reagent (150 μL) was added to 15 μL of extracts or ascorbic acid. The blanks were constituted by mixing 150 μL of phosphomolybdate reagent solution and 15 μL of DMSO. The microplate was incubated in a waterbath at 80°C for 90 min, then cooled down to room temperature. The absorbance was read at 695 nm using an ELx800 microplate reader. The total antioxidant capacity (TAC) of plant extracts was derived from the calibration curve of ascorbic acid and expressed as equivalent of ascorbic acid.
